19#include "GenericGFPoly.h"
20
21#include <algorithm>
22#include <cassert>
23#include <vector>
24#include <stdexcept>
25
26namespace ZXing {
27
28/**
29* <p>This class contains utility methods for performing mathematical operations over
30* the Galois Fields. Operations use a given primitive polynomial in calculations.</p>
31*
32* <p>Throughout this package, elements of the GF are represented as an {@code int}
33* for convenience and speed (but at the cost of memory).
34* </p>
35*
36* @author Sean Owen
37* @author David Olivier
38*/
39class GenericGF
40{
41public:
42 static const GenericGF& AztecData12();
43 static const GenericGF& AztecData10();
44 static const GenericGF& AztecData6();
45 static const GenericGF& AztecParam();
46 static const GenericGF& QRCodeField256();
47 static const GenericGF& DataMatrixField256();
48 static const GenericGF& AztecData8();
49 static const GenericGF& MaxiCodeField64();
50
51 /**
52 * @return the monomial representing coefficient * x^degree
53 */
54 GenericGFPoly& setMonomial(GenericGFPoly& poly, int degree, int coefficient) const
55 {
56 assert(degree >= 0);
57
58 if (coefficient == 0)
59 degree = 0;
60
61 poly._field = this;
62 poly._coefficients.resize(degree + 1);
63 std::fill(poly._coefficients.begin(), poly._coefficients.end(), 0);
64 poly._coefficients.front() = coefficient;
65
66 return poly;
67 }
68
69 GenericGFPoly& setZero(GenericGFPoly& poly) const {
70 return setMonomial(poly, 0, 0);
71 }
72
73 GenericGFPoly& setOne(GenericGFPoly& poly) const {
74 return setMonomial(poly, 0, 1);
75 }
76
77 /**
78 * Implements both addition and subtraction -- they are the same in GF(size).
79 *
80 * @return sum/difference of a and b
81 */
82 int addOrSubtract(int a, int b) const noexcept {
83 return a ^ b;
84 }
85
86 /**
87 * @return 2 to the power of a in GF(size)
88 */
89 int exp(int a) const {
90 return _expTable.at(a);
91 }
92
93 /**
94 * @return base 2 log of a in GF(size)
95 */
96 int log(int a) const {
97 if (a == 0) {
98 throw std::invalid_argument("a == 0");
99 }
100 return _logTable.at(a);
101 }
102
103 /**
104 * @return multiplicative inverse of a
105 */
106 int inverse(int a) const {
107 return _expTable[_size - log(a) - 1];
108 }
109
110 /**
111 * @return product of a and b in GF(size)
112 */
113 int multiply(int a, int b) const noexcept {
114 if (a == 0 || b == 0) {
115 return 0;
116 }
117 auto fast_mod = [](const int input, const int ceil) {
118 // avoid using the '%' modulo operator => ReedSolomon computation is more than twice as fast
119 // see also https://stackoverflow.com/a/33333636/2088798
120 return input < ceil ? input : input - ceil;
121 };
122 return _expTable[fast_mod(_logTable[a] + _logTable[b], _size - 1)];
123 }
124
125
126 int size() const {
127 return _size;
128 }
129
130 int generatorBase() const {
131 return _generatorBase;
132 }
133
134private:
135 const int _size;
136 int _generatorBase;
137 std::vector<int> _expTable;
138 std::vector<int> _logTable;
139
140 /**
141 * Create a representation of GF(size) using the given primitive polynomial.
142 *
143 * @param primitive irreducible polynomial whose coefficients are represented by
144 * the bits of an int, where the least-significant bit represents the constant
145 * coefficient
146 * @param size the size of the field
147 * @param b the factor b in the generator polynomial can be 0- or 1-based
148 * (g(x) = (x+a^b)(x+a^(b+1))...(x+a^(b+2t-1))).
149 * In most cases it should be 1, but for QR code it is 0.
150 */
151 GenericGF(int primitive, int size, int b);
152};
153
154} // ZXing
155
